body:
Allow variants with no `values` parameter to be interpreted as single-value variants (rather than boolean variants) if their default value is a non-boolean value. These variants will be given `values=lambda x: True`.

This allows for easy open-ended variants
```python
variant('config_file', default='/etc', description='location of the config file')
```
Can take any input, and will attempt to locate a config file at that location.

Started this on the wrong branch, so some extra commits appear in the log. They'll be squashed out anyway.
title: Open ended variants
